boundary.description: The boundary area for the popper. Used within the `preventOverflow` modifier.

closeDelay.description: The number of delay time to close.

closeOnBlur.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you blur out it by clicking outside or tabbing out.

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you hit the `Esc` key.

defaultIsOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be initially opened.

defaultOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be initially opened.

eventListeners.description: If provided, determines whether the popper will reposition itself on `scroll`  and `resize` of the window.

flip.description: If `true`, the popper will change its placement and flip when it's about to overflow its boundary area.

gutter.description:
The distance or margin between the reference and popper.
It is used internally to create an `offset` modifier.

isLazy.description: If `true`, the PopoverContent rendering will be deferred until the popover is open.

isOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be opened.

lazy.description: If `true`, the PopoverContent rendering will be deferred until the popover is open.

lazyBehavior.description:
The lazy behavior of popover's content when not visible. Only works when `lazy={true}`

- `unmount`: The popover's content is always unmounted when not open.
- `keepMounted`: The popover's content initially unmounted, but stays mounted when popover is open.

matchWidth.description:
If `true`, the popper will match the width of the reference at all times.
It's useful for `autocomplete`, `date-picker` and `select` patterns.

modifiers.description:
Array of popper.js modifiers.
Check the docs to see the list of possible modifiers you can pass.

offset.description: The main and cross-axis offset to displace popper element from its reference element.

onClose.description: Callback fired when the popover closes.

onOpen.description: Callback fired when the popover opens.

open.description: If `true`, the popover will be opened.

openDelay.description: The number of delay time to open.

placement.description: The placement of the popper relative to its reference.

preventOverflow.description: If `true`, will prevent the popper from being cut off and ensure it's visible within the boundary area.

strategy.description: The CSS positioning strategy to use.

autoFocus.description: If `true`, focus will be transferred to the first interactive element when the popover opens.

boundary.description: The boundary area for the popper. Used within the `preventOverflow` modifier.

closeDelay.description: The number of delay time to close.

closeOnBlur.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you blur out it by clicking outside or tabbing out.

closeOnButton.description: If `true`, display the popover close button.

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you hit the `Esc` key.

defaultIsOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be initially opened.

defaultOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be initially opened.

eventListeners.description: If provided, determines whether the popper will reposition itself on `scroll`  and `resize` of the window.

flip.description: If `true`, the popper will change its placement and flip when it's about to overflow its boundary area.

gutter.description:
The distance or margin between the reference and popper.
It is used internally to create an `offset` modifier.

initialFocusRef.description: The `ref` of the element that should receive focus when the popover opens.

isLazy.description: If `true`, the PopoverContent rendering will be deferred until the popover is open.

isOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be opened.

lazy.description: If `true`, the PopoverContent rendering will be deferred until the popover is open.

lazyBehavior.description:
The lazy behavior of popover's content when not visible. Only works when `lazy={true}`

- `unmount`: The popover's content is always unmounted when not open.
- `keepMounted`: The popover's content initially unmounted, but stays mounted when popover is open.

matchWidth.description:
If `true`, the popper will match the width of the reference at all times.
It's useful for `autocomplete`, `date-picker` and `select` patterns.

modifiers.description:
Array of popper.js modifiers.
Check the docs to see the list of possible modifiers you can pass.

offset.description: The main and cross-axis offset to displace popper element from its reference element.

onClose.description: Callback fired when the popover closes.

onOpen.description: Callback fired when the popover opens.

open.description: If `true`, the popover will be opened.

openDelay.description: The number of delay time to open.

placement.description: The placement of the popper relative to its reference.

preventOverflow.description: If `true`, will prevent the popper from being cut off and ensure it's visible within the boundary area.

relatedRef.description:
The `ref` of the element related to the popover.
This is used during the `onBlur` event.

restoreFocus.description: If `true`, focus will be returned to the element that triggers the popover when it closes.

strategy.description: The CSS positioning strategy to use.

trigger.description:
The interaction that triggers the popover.

- `hover`: means the popover will open when you hover with mouse or focus with keyboard on the popover trigger.
- `click`: means the popover will open on click or press `Enter` to `Space` on keyboard.

disableRipple.description: If `true`, disable ripple effects when pressing a element.

isRounded.description: If true, the button is full rounded.

containerProps.description: The props of the container element.
